intro: Baccaurea puberula, commonly known as the hairy baccaurea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of India, Malaysia, and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, fleshy fruits that are typically red or yellow when mature. The botanical features of Baccaurea puberula make it an interesting subject for study in tropical botany and ecological research.
